main event: An object was observed flying in the night sky over Lovinger, Missouri on June 14, 1959.
interesting points: The object was initially thought to be the evening star but was too low and late for that., The observer described the object as round, red and green in color., The object was seen on a southerly course at an altitude of 2,200 to 2,500 feet., The sighting lasted about 15 minutes without the use of optical aids., The report was submitted to a nearby weather station.
sighted object: a round, red and green object
